message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.SI, cs.HC. 

The paper deals with the problem of optimizing the quality of customer segmentation through the selection and sequencing of quiz questions. This involves modeling user behavior as a Markov process and using conditional entropy to measure the utility of a given group of quiz questions. The paper thus falls under the broad category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG), as it involves developing strategies for optimizing a specific task. It also involves information retrieval (cs.IR) and social and information networks (cs.SI), as it deals with personalized content and customer segmentation. Finally, it touches upon human-computer interaction (cs.HC), as it involves designing quizzes that are engaging and effective in generating leads and increasing e-commerce sales.
